page.title: 05Farm Cattle
page.content: Until 1975 the South Devon and Jersey breeds were seen on the Maristow Estate. Now dairying is the main source of income the Fresian plays an important part with a total herd of 400 cows. These produce some 6500 litres of milk per cow per year, and have been chosen for their milk yield,quality and bull calf selling price at market.120 heffer calves are kept as replacements, 240 cows are put to Fresian or Holstein bulls, the rest to cross bred bulls.Heffers for their first calving are put to beef type bulls, either Hereford or Aberdeen Angus. Milk is collected daily by tanker lorry and taken to the Co-op dairy for retail. Farmers are now paid for the high protein content rather than the high fat content as the diet conscious public demand low fat food.
